article_title: Inside CMS Proposed Mental Health Parity Rules
article_text:
Inside CMS Proposed Mental Health Parity Rules

Law360, New York (April 13, 2015, 12:44 PM ET) -- Last week, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services issued long-awaited proposed rules for mental health parity in Medicaid and the Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP). 80 Fed. Reg. 19418 (April 10, 2015). Although much of the content of the proposed rules was expected, there are several provisions that may be challenging for states and Medicaid managed care entities to comply with, if they are finalized in their current form.



Background



In 1996, Congress passed the Mental Health Parity Act of 1996, Pub. L. No. 104-204,...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: Although much of the content of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services' long-awaited proposed rules for mental health parity in Medicaid and the Children’s Health Insurance Program was expected, there are several provisions that may be challenging for states and Medicaid managed care entities to comply with, if they are finalized in their current form, say Caroline Brown and Phil Peisch of Covington & Burling LLP.
